intro: Cynoglossum formosanum f. albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower betony, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shady environments. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The foliage has a mild, minty aroma and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
